Food was good and service was good, especially the cute waitress!!...(ARGH..what am I thinking?..I'm there for the food, not a date!!).  My only complaint was that I wasn't a big fan of their side dishes (spicy radish; pickled cucumbers; kimchi; sprout salad (only thing I ate); bunch of small dried fishes, and one big fish.
author: Gary Y.

description: Perhaps my expectations were elevated reading all the great reviews posted on the entry wall.  But, I didn't think much of the main #1 hot tofu soup.  I've tried other Korean tofu houses and this version just doesn't match up.  The other dishes were passable and the traditional tiny appetizers were pretty good.  The ambience was bright and the restaurant was clean.  I wouldn't recommend coming here for great Korean food, but if you just looking for a quick Korean bite, this place will do.
author: David P.

description: This is my favorite Korean restaurant in the city.  It's delicious food at a reasonable price.  I would recommend going with the Kimchi Soft Tofu Soup and Kalbi Beef for two people.  It's a tremendous value at about $32 for both dishes.  In addition to the two dishes, the meal comes with rice and starts off with a bunch of small side dishes.
author: Josh K.

description: On a cold, foggy summer night in San Francisco, they serve the best Korean comfort food ever!  Just fire up the Dumpling and Tofu Soup, spicy please, an order of Kalbi, and the combination pancake and I'll be a happy camper!  Go before 7pm on the weekends and you'll avoid some of the wait and service is a little better.
author: Yvonne C.

description: This place is always packed and they have great Bi Bim Bap.  Wish they have more side dishes though, love the dried baby fishes
author: Hugh L.

description:
i have to say i'm a regular...but not like i eat there ALL the time, but i do go at least once a month.  i only get the kimchi soondubu...SPICY...and i'm never diappointed....well, unless i compare it to the soondubu i get from philly at Jong Jia Ip (see my review).  It's not getting 5 stars because i hate the line, but that's really not their fault...or is it?

oh yeah, the kimchi on the side is always good.
author: Sally T.

description: It was my first time here on a recommendation from a friend.  We ordered different version of their Tofu Soup.  My wife ordered the mushroom tofu with ramen not spicy.  Very tasty soup.  The ramen was a nice touch. I had the beef with mushroom tofu soup medium spicy. For me it was just the right amount of spiciness.  The tofu was plentiful.  It was a good soup.  My other friend had the same soup but with kim chi and spicy.  She seemed to enjoy it since there was nothing left. We also ordered the Kal Bi.  It was also tasty. Good cut of meat.  They added a lot onions.  More so than I have seen at other Korean BBQ houses.  The side dishes are not as plentiful as some other korean restaurants I have been to.  But they do give you a fried fish for each person.  Not bad.  This place is good.  I would go back if I was in the neighborhood.  The staff was attentive and friendly.  It was crowded that night and they did hustle to make sure tables were served, cleaned, and cleared to make room for other folks, but not at the expense of rushing you.  It's a good neighborhood joint if you are in the mood for Tofu soup.
author: Mike V.

description:
I've been here a total of three times. Each time I was hoping to be to find out why so many people come here.  What's the secret?  Every time I've been puzzled. The appetizers were extremely mediocre and not too varied and the tofu soup, the supposed specialty, had no outstanding qualities as the broth was weak and watery and the ingredients not too tasty.
  Unlike at other Korean restaurants where you can actually taste the nuances in food that make it their signatuare, there's no discernible signature taste to My Tofu House's cuisine, other than there is not too much flavor or texture to it.  It's not horrible but it's not even good.
author: Tara W.

description:
Good for a korean food fix.. i agree that I have yet to find a REAL winner among korean restaurants in SF but the tofu and kalbi hits the spot.

Decor is totally lacking if you're looking for ambience.  It's very casual.
Service is harried because they are often packed with a little bit of a wait, but they are SUPER friendly.
author: jayne y.

description: My favorite korean restaurant in SF. Their tofu soups are spectacular as well as their side dishes. The only bad thing about this place is the gum they give you afterwards that taste awful.
author: Prescott T.

description: I went with a really strong craving for soon do boo, but no one to go with me. So I ordered the tofu kimchi soup to go. Maybe this is just because it was to go, but it didn't sizzle like I wanted it to. Also, whenever I've had this dish at other restaurants they give you an egg to crack into your soup. I didn't realize how much I'd miss that egg. I'm still on the search for soup good korean tofu in san francisco. If anyone can help me, i'd really appreciate it.
author: Chelsea S.

description: Best Korean BBQ in all of SF. I know people will dispute this given how good Brothers is, but i think overall this place is the best.  Service is incredible.  The guys that work there are all over making sure you have everything you need and work their tail off.  One of them is an absolute dream boat to look at.
author: Ryan A.

description: Mmmmm.  Spicy tofu soup.  It's hardy, satisfying on a cold foggy day.  Love the barely tea and short ribs are pretty good.  Rice in a stone pot is awesome, just like mom used to make it.  OK, we didn't have a stone pot, just a worn out aluminum rice cooker.
author: Ming L.

description:
4.5 

i'm korean and eat tofu soup all the time, from korea to new york to chicago to LA,  San Francisco Korean food just sucks in general.  That being said it is the best in the city , and they do give you lots of side dishes.  

If this place was in any other city mentioned it would only get 3 stars at most
author: Peter L.

description: Came here for a few years and I LOVE THIS PLACE! Can't go wrong with the food, haven't had a bad experience yet. *knocks on wood* The kal bi here is great, juicy and tender. The soup isn't watered down, just the way I like it! I just wish they served jap chae here, but that's ok since their food makes up for it! Service is pretty great here too, and very attentive. Come here with my nephew and sister and since hes only 2, they know that he doesn't drink the spicy soup. So they give him a non-spicy soup on the house every time we come here, now thats great service! Great people that work here, the only thing I would complain about is that they are a bit slow, such as in refilling your tea, or bringing you your bill. Other than that, I love their appetizers, the soup, everything they have to offer! Great place, just be sure to be there before 7:30 because thats when the rush of people come in.
author: Johnson S.

description:
good hardcore soondubu
i would liken it to the strong, standard soondubu places of ktown in L.A.

If it matters, Im korean
if it dont matter, i wont use proper punctuation

warning to some of you: this is considered a korean fast food of sorts.  in further words, sit down, eat a lot, get the F out.  so dont expect the waiter to kiss your ass or recognize how beautiful you are

if you want to put hot lava in your belly, cool. 
if you want to be seen & heard, go to mission or castro
author: X X.

description: it's the only koren tofu house that I know in the city....I had better down in south bay - but beggers can't be choosers.  They specialize in korean spicy tofu soup called soondubu chijae. They make different kinds. For those who don't like tofu, they also make other stuff - but then why bother going there.....  I know some people like to share the soup, but I don't know...you should really get your own soup.
author: ji k.

description: This was my first time to My Tofu House and I was pleasantly surprised.  The ambiance was very clean and the asian styled booths are cute.  The food was pretty good although not amazing.  The stoneware bibimbab was very spicy at "medium."  Good though, good for those cold Richmond nights.
author: Dana C.

description: Attentive staff, superb tofu soup, a variety of pickled vegetables, great bulgoki and chicken...what more can one ask for?!?!?!?!?
author: Juli S.

description: A restaurant's name could not be more fitting.  While this place offers other items I only go for the  Soon dubu, tofo stew.  It offers various types, original with beef or pork and mushroom, a seafood and a mushroom only.  It gives you a choice of spice degree, mild, medium and spicy.  The spicy is just perfect for me.  On a cold, misty or foggy San Francisco day you can not beat the tofu stef.  Great flavor, a courteous wait staff.  The place is spotless.   You get your usual banchan, side dishes.
author: Kevin A.

description: Oh my dubu! Soon dubu is one of favorite korean dishes and I've had it all over. Korea, New York, Washington D.C., San Francisco, LA, and it's not bad here. Don't get me wrong, it's not orgasmic or anything, but it compares well to all the other places I've tried. Perhaps it's because making soon dubu isn't exactly rocket science.
author: Peter S.

description: Soondubu!  G'yeah!  This spot has the BEST soondubu in the Richmond.  There are a few other dishes on the menu, but don't f*ck around, just get the soondubu.
author: Al K.

description: Really good place to go when you're in the mood for tofu soup!  This past time I also tried the tofu salad, which isn't bad either.  The only downside is that they tend to be crowded, so you might have to wait awhile.
author: Shannon E.

description: Home away from home cooking!  All the 'stews' are wonderful and the kalbi is very lean and delicious here!  I go often and am never disappointed.  When my mother came to visit from Korea, this was her favorite place as well!  Enjoy it - get it spicy!
author: sHoo o.

description: Good tofu, long waits, and no alcohol allowed. On the last point, they don't serve it and they don't let it in the door.
author: Joyce S.

description:
my absolute favorite korean place in all of san francisco..

the tofu soup.. comes in mild, medium, spicy and VERY spicy.. 

granted i love spicy spicy foods.. but even the medium is quite spicy for me.. the put a lot of great ingrediants into their soups.. a lot of other korean restaurants that i have been too really skim on ingrediants.. and i'm sometimes left to wonder if this is a pork tofu soup.. or just a soup with lots of chili in it. 

but NOT my tofu house.. it's overloaded with tofu and your favorite choice of meat/seafood! 

the bulgogi is sweet and savory and not burned like many other korean places! 

go here on a windy rainy san francisco day (which is everyday).
author: Lisa C.

description:
food:  very good to awesome!
it's very basic korean food, soondubu, rice and banchan (side dishes), i've never tried their meats but i'm sure it's good, too.  kids can have their own tofu soup and they love it (my 2 year old loves loves their food).

service:  decent but need to hire more people (that's why only 4 stars)

price:  cheap (average $12-15 including tip per person-depending on what you order)

parking: drive around, you'll find something within a block or two.
author: Jane R.

description: I am compelled to agree with the 4 star trend here, because, well, it's that good. This place has a great selection of different sizzling Korean stews and soups. If you're in the market for those, then by all means come here. They have a pretty good bibimbap for good measure.
author: Steven S.

description: For some reason chicken soup doesn't cure my colds -- the spices of korean food does. SF is taking the white out of this boy, I think. Anyhow, consistently great spicy pork, clay pot for the rice, and tasty side dishes make this one of the best Korean places in inner richmond that I've found.
author: k w.

description: AMAZING korean tofu soup! I have tried this soup in Fort Lee, Dallas, NYC, etc. This is hands down the best ever...soft tofu, delicious clams, perfect heat (spiciness). Service was quick and efficient, too. The decor is less than stellar but who really cares when the food is good?
author: Elle S.

description: I love this place.  The soups are the best, especially spicy.  I have been going here for years and the only draw back is the line.  Once you get passed the line, service is fast and friendly.
author: michael c.

description: I LOVE this place. The best thing to get here is (duh) the Tofu Soup. It's esp great during the cold winter days. They give you SO MUCH food for the price. It's about 10 bucks for a tofu soup (the original and mushroom tofu soup are my faves) and it comes with rice, and about 8 of those little dishes (kimchee, bean sprouts, teeny fried fish). Trust me, you will surely be full after this meal. And you don't come out smelling like korean BBQ!
author: J K L.

description: I can't say I'm well-versed in Korean cuisine, but I will say this for My Tofu House: it's perfect comfort food on a blustery winter day.
author: SaraMitra P.

description: I'm a white guy,  but I know my asian food.  Good grub.  Stick with the soup.  The BBQ and rice dishes are ok, but I've had better.  We waited about 20 min on a cold rainy night for a table, but the Kimchi warmed us up soon enough!  It's a good place to take someone to ease them into Korean food.
author: Brent P.

description: I love the pan fried fish appetizer!  Don't forget to try their tofu soup with ramen, it's best!  The price is reasonable and very good table services.
author: Jamie L.

description: Not enough depth, although prices are good and the soft tofu a HOT experience
author: Alex A.

description: It's pretty clean in here. There was one chicken dish that was pretty good. I forgot what it was called. Sorta like teriyaki chicken? On a hot plate. When it arrives to your table, it's all real hot and sizzling. =)
author: Katherine C.

description: Absolutely the BEST rice in the city. The way they cook in the stone bowl is perfect. Trust me on this one. I know rice. I ate rice almost every meal for about 27 years, until I came to the US. We the Japanese are VERY picky about rice. I like their tofu soup but mainly I come here for great rice.
author: Wakaknee J.

description: The tofu soup here ranks among the best I've had and that alone will keep me coming back.  I love the appetizers here too, but they're the standard ones you get at any korean restaurant.
author: Stephen G.

description: Four words....TOFU SOUP EXTRA SPICY!!!  I have been here about 3 times now and I am never let down.  This past visit I was delighted to fill my stomach with a mushroom tofu soup extra spicy.  I just about died and went to heaven.  It you are feeling sick it is a great dish.  It will really clear your sinuses.  All the kimchis are amazing, and although we sat in the hidden back room near the bathroom, nothing could have made it better.
author: Samantha R.

description: Soon Tofu is solid.  I like to get the kimchi flavor it adds extra oomph.  The spicy pork is delish.  The variety of side dishes that come out before the meal is a nice distraction when you're starving and your main meal hasn't come out yet.
author: Blu n.

description: Don't be an idiot and try to touch the clay rice pot.  I know those are hard to find in restaurants now a days, just stare at it and let the waiter handle it.  I too am a fan of their tofu soup and yes, I'm easily amused...I enjoy cracking the egg and watching it cook like a little kid.  As far as the BBQ dishes, it's tasty. However, it tastes exactly the same as Korean Village one store down.  -1 because the wait was way too long.
author: Jacquelynne S.

description: Be expected to wait a while if you come for dinner. Prices range from $10-$20 for each plate. I ordered the vegetable soft tofu soup as mild. I've never eaten tofu soup before so I thought it was cool. I also learned how to use chopsticks to eat rice too. All in all, it's a clean place to eat and the servers are very friendly.
author: Jasleen K.

description:
My Tofu House isn't a bad place to eat, but it isn't particularly inviting.  My girlfriend and I came here on a Saturday night, when it wasn't overly busy; however, despite the fact that there were open tables and no line at the time, it felt like the place was heavily understaffed, as it took us several minutes to be seated.  Overall, delays in service were particularly off-putting, as it took us ten minutes to get the side dishes and close to a full half-hour to get our food (nevermind that some people that arrived later were served before us).  This basically meant a lot of sitting around at a small table watching the line lengthen - the waiter barely even came around to add more tea (in about an hour and a half of eating, I believe our tea was refilled about...once).

That being said, the tofu was good; I got the medium Kimchi Tofu Soup, and my girlfriend got the mild Original Tofu Soup.  My medium was actually spicier than expected, which is exactly what I've been looking for at a Korean restaurant; as well, the quantity provided for the price was also quite good.  The side dishes, on the other hand, were not quite as good, with several being significantly more sour than we tend to prefer.

Overall, based on the food alone, My Tofu House would get four stars; however, given the long wait we had (including five minutes for the waiter to come over and take our order) after we were seated and the overall neglect by waiters, I can't justify a score over three stars.
author: Benjamin L.

description: It is great that Korean restaurants are popping up all over that don't just serve kalbi.  Korean food is more than just bbq and kimchee.  This place reminds me of many places south of here so it makes me nostalgic for my homeland:  Los Angeles.
author: aleks k.

description: I like their tofu soup the best compare to other korean restaurant. Their BBQ is allright, a lil bit too dry, not juicy and meaty like what I like. I love the soup to be REALLY spicy. But most of my friends prefer it medium to mild. I love one of their side dish, the fried fish which is salty. I always ask for another one since they only give 1 per table. And they dont charge the extra fish. The service is descent but slow when it is crowded.
author: Etika T.

description: Only been here twice but the service is always top notch and it's clean. *thumbs up*  They've got flat screen tv's now! this last time the appatizer thingies were a bit to pickled for my tastes, and I always seem to burn my tounge on the tofu cause i can't wait to scarf it down. Can't really say much cuase my taste buds aren't really tuned into korean food. But i do like me some spicey tofu's. Next time i'll try the medium.
author: Ed H.

description: I love My Tofu House.  Its less than a block from my house and a friend of mine who visits regularly from out of town always insists that we eat there.  The service is efficient and polite.  The health inspection rating is 100%!  Its definitely always clean in there.  I always order the tofu salad and the pork bbq (please excuse me for not knowing the Korean name), and I love the pickled cucumbers from the side dishes, which are so crunchy and refreshing.  My friend always gets the mushroom tofu soup, spicy, and then always regrets getting it spicy. - and he's from Louisiana, so he knows spicy food! Its really almost too spicy, where you can't taste the food.  So order stuff mild and you can add more spice later on.
author: Celeste L.

description: Despite the name, this place is not some crusty, hippy, vegetarian restaurant.  It is an excellent Korean restaurant.  Great for when you crave bulgogi and kimchi but don't want to go home smelling like smoke, which can be a draw back from eating at Brothers.  The tofu salad is nothing special, but it is refreshingly cooling to nibble on while enjoying the ripping hot dumplings with tofu or bibimbop.  Service was always prompt and they did a good job of keeping my tea and water full the whole time, which can be difficult because I'm a thirsty guy.
author: Benjamin P.

description: Comfort food through and through if you're familiar with Korean soon tubu jji gae. I LOVE the mushroom one.  I just close my eyes, burn my tongue and eat until nothing is left over.  It's amazing how good this is.  I tried to make it at home but forget it.... The House is the best.
author: Hadley K.

description: The Tofu House has pretty good korean food, but definitely not the best in San Francisco.  The pros are that the restaurant is pretty clean and the food comes out quickly.  It is a little expensive, but it is worth it.  I love all their tofu soups and korean bbq.  The staff is not the best, but sometimes they'll have hot Korean men working there which is a plus.  The reason I give this place three stars is because they make you stand in an awkward narrow isle while you wait for a table.  The wait can be up to thirty minutes.
author: Maggie L.

description: The tofu soup is very good.  Other than that, the portion of the other dishes is so small.  Also, the appetizers are quite salty and sweet.  I went there when I was pregnant and needed to control the intake of sugar and carbs to stablize the blood sugar level.  Tofu House failed at that point and I got a super high reading that night after the dinner and a 40 minutes walk afterwards.
author: Roserrele W.

description:
I really don't see the hype about this place..overrated, I say.

The food was only sub-par, it was definitely overpriced, and they're stingy with the portions (and the side dishes - no refills?).  Here's the thing that turned me off the most about this place - HORRIBLE service.  The line is always extremely long, and the last time I went, the waiter let another party cut in front of us when we were clearly next on the list (and the other party's name was crossed out)!!  When we finally got seated, they seated us in the back room where it was stuffy and hot and the waiter hardly ever came to check on us.

Tofu Village definitely beats this place. Don't bother waiting in line at Tofu House, not worth it.  I repeat, not worth it.
author: Connie Y.

description: Food was pretty good . The spicy kimchee tofu soup was not as spicy as I thought it would be but it was still good . I prefer the tofu soup at Wang Daegam .. it's much spicier and better . The tofu salad was good .. the tofu was very firm . They are skimpy on the side dishes compared to other Korean restaurants . They only give you 4 side dishes . The Korean waiters are cute !! I'll be back for sure , hehe . Just to let you know , this place is packed sometimes , so you might have to wait in line for a table .
author: Eileen L.

description: The tofu soup bowls here are great.  I ordered a Seafood Tofu Soup last time I went and it makes me want to go back there again.  But watch out if you can't eat spicy foods.  Be sure to ask for mild or you're going have to drink a lot of water.  However, the mixture of spices and ingredients makes the perfect tofu soup bowl!
author: Ernesto F.

description: This is one good Korean place.  So yes they got the korean dishes you would expect and prices are pretty decent.  Tofu soup is very good and all the little free extras they give you are awesome and tasty.  Preserved cucumbers were so good.  Their short ribs and chicken were all very fantastic.  This place is a must visit!!!
author: Allan T.

description: Good, solid spot for a Korean fix. Er, a Korean food fix. There was a bit of a line on a Saturday night, but the place was filled with Koreans (a good sign, no?). Two of us shared a kimchi soft tofu and some daeji bulgogi (broiled sliced spicy pork) and had some pork leftover. They gave us 4-5 different sides, including bean sprouts, kim chi, pickled daikon, pickled cucumber, and the dried little fishies. They gave us an egg to put in the kimchi soft tofu, yum! Lastly, they also gave us a side of two fried fish, each one about the length and half the width of your hand. This was super tasty! Lightly salty, went great with the white rice. The rice came in the big black stone bowl thing with a lid on it. They strangely didn't fill it with water at the end of the meal like I've seen them do at other restaurants. The service was attentive though and they willingly brought me more side dishes as I finished them. Reasonably priced, tasty food!
author: Christine L.

description:
great lunch special: tea, panchan, claypot rice with peas, tofu stew or a generous servinig of bbq. all about $8.50 to $10.00. i haven't had their bbq but my friend got kalbi and it looked like a lot. i had tofu stew w/ dumplings and it was very good but didn't knock my socks off.

3.5 for now, maybe higher (or lower) when i go back and try their bbq.
author: Dana D.

description: This is the best place to go for some great Korean soup and comfort food.  It always hits the spot on a cold day and you crave tofu.
author: Charles C.

description: I love tofu!, and this is the place for some great soft and silky tofu dishes.  Clay pots of tofu w/ yummy broth.  Definitely hits the spot when it's a foggy, cold evening.  Amongst the tofu, there are the typical Korean meat varieties.  Very average service, and very average atmosphere.
author: K N.

description:
good food but most of the time they're under staffed = long wait = not so good service.  but i'll take it, their tofu soup's good ;)

expect a long wait during lunch time.
author: kulas a.

description:
FOOD: 9.5/10
PRICE: 9/10
PEOPLE: 8/10 because sometimes it gets a little crowded

PERIOD.
author: Rob C.

description: Hmm....It was good.  Not great.  I ordered the fish roe and clams tofu soup, but it didn't have any clams!!  Oh well - I will just have to keep searching for another tofu house.  Note the boy waiters are cute and have great haircuts.
author: g. y.

description: The service is really bad. The waitress has bad attitude. She tried to charge us high tip after gave us the really bad service. My friends and I went to have dinner tonight, Total are  5 people at night. During the night, they don't really serve us. We were sitting there and wait for more than 10min, nobody can take our order. I have to go to the register counter to tell them we are ready. And then, we still wait at least 5 min for the waiter. When we are ready to pay the bill, we find out that the tips is already include to the total amount and they charge us really high tips rate. We ask for how much tips they charge us. The waitress said 16%. We calculated it and found out they charge us 18% after tax. And then, I talked the waitress and asked she to explain, she said they has right to charge us more tips because we have 5 people.I don't understand that part. And when we come in , nobody explain that. But the most important thing is she even said I med at her and I has a bad attitude. I won't visit this restaurant again and I won't recommend anyone go to this restaurant!!!
author: Jing L.

description: This tofu house is a best tofu house i've been to in the bay area.  The food comes out piping hot and the banchan are great.  I only wished they had the soy sauce potatoes as one of the banchan.  The meat is a bit overpriced but overall the soft tofu is great and i would recommend it to all those who want a warm dish on a cold foggy SF night.
author: Stephen C.

description: The first thing you should do when you get here is put your name on the waiting list!!! Luckily I yelped this place before I went and knew there was a wait list (kinda hard to see with all the people standing in the waiting area). We waited for about 20 minutes, wasn't that bad. Got seated and served tea... the tea was bad... it tasted like bad water. I ordered the Mushroom Soft Tofu (Spicy) with Ramen (should add this to their website's menu). The mushroom soft tofu came out boiling hot!! It was very yummy, there was a good assortment of mushrooms .. it was too spicy for me, next time i would order less spicy! The soft tofu was satisfying and really filling!! The only bad thing is there was not enough workers and the line was really long and at one point there were 4 empty tables but no one cleaning the tables. -1 star for the bad tea/water thing. I would definitely come back again for the soft tofu only though! everything else sucks.
author: Kimi D.

description: This place is awesome. I usually get the ramen and tofu soup and the BBQ chicken. The side dishes are awesome and the service is good.
author: Andi Nicole V.

description: If there a line, go to the front and SIGN UP first before continue waiting! Being a dorkus maximus last night forgetting to do that. My tofu house is my new favorite Korea tofu stew place in the city. Service is great when it's not super packed. I usually go for the combination tofu stew ($7.50) since I just being a greedy lil punk that wants everything.
author: David C.

description: i'm extremely impressed with their tasty tofu seafood soup ...n their ribs ...yum yum yum.  You can chose how spicy you want your soup. Pretty comfortable booths for all the seating. Give it a try!!
author: stephanie n.

description: All the classics - bulgogi,  galbi-gui, kimchi - at decent pricing. I think my entree was about $10 and you get all those never ending 'lil side dishes.  The soondubu (tofu stews) will have my parents coming back.  The service is kinda slow, but the staff is nice.  Lines build up quickly. After dinner ran to the Pig and Whistle to wet mine, NO ALCOHOL at the House.
author: Cliff L.

description: MMMMMMMMM this place is so good! I always get the spicy beef and spicy tofu soup with egg.  Im getting hungry just talking bout it!
author: Kool G.

description: First real korean style restaurant i've been to. I was surprise to get so many mini appetizers. bibimpop was my favorite! it was all sizzling when it came to the table. the service was great and i would definitely come back.
author: Lynn P.

description: My Korean friend recommended this place. I was a little disappointed because the mushroom and tofu soup was too bland. I'm not saying it should have been spicier, just wanted more flavor. On the other hand, I really enjoyed the assorted side dishes including a whole fried (grilled?) fish, kimchees and vegetables.
author: Mia D.

description: Love it!  It is my go to place!  Can't go wrong with any of the soondooboos or the dolsot bimbimbap.  Don't sit in the back room though, it actually makes a difference!
author: Big e.

description: Very good food, and good service.  FOod was fast to come out, and the soup was excellent.  Only thing that was bad was the wait they have sometime, and it can get pretty hot in there but it is a restaurant so I can't complain.
author: Susana Y.

description: absoulutely delicious! This is the place for hot tofu soup, babimbab and mouth watering kalbi (ribs) that will melt in your mouth. The menu is limited but honestly, who needs it when they have such good food. The service is excellent, considering how busy they are. And for the price, the is as good as it gets.
author: benjamin c.

description:
nice taste of tofu i admit
althou, if you want #1 service, you really can't expect it here
i like nice service, nice people,
but the ppl  who work here seem very busy with other tables, not enough waiter i can say,
so when i came here i fet ignored & coincidently my waiter is verry irritating-looking-at me.
waiting kinda long for the food, fo course not enough ppl tht working here
you'll definitely find your own seat & get your own menu from somewhere if you spotted it...
hmm but they have nice food overall
author: Ms C.

description:
I like the metal rice bowls... only if they had metal chopsticks, too.

Had the mushroom soondubu at medium spicy. Good flavor, nice 'shrooms (was that a chanterelle?). The panchan was not super bountiful but good quality. My favorite was the raw, red squid. Kimchee was just ok.

Definitely would head back for more.
author: jj w.

description: A friend recommended this restaurant so I tried it.  The soup was great, I loved how hot it was in the stone bowl and cooking an egg in it before starting to eat.  I don't have a great frame of reference for how quality stacks up, but the soft tofu soup was definitely better than the stuff I've had at some of the Korean BBQ places.  I think this would be great for weekend late breakfast - the egg plus the spiciness good for hangover eradication.  I will be going back.
author: Eric D.

description: Bibimba here is more expensive here then most Korean restaurant I have been, and its not even that good.  The Tofu soup was more bland then I have ever tasted (perhpaps it was our fault for asking for a non-spicy...who would have thought it would come with no flavor??).  Number of side dishes as well as variety was not impressive.   There are too many other better places down in South Bay for me to think of a reason to returning to this place.
author: iris w.

description: I am not the biggest fan of Korean food. I always prefer to have Japanese food. However, if that is not an option, and I am craving Korean food, this  is the place to eat. My friend introduced me to this restaurant, and ever since then, I have never been disappointed. I like this place because it doesn't try to be anything more than what it is....which is a good korean restaurant. It doesn't try to do anything extra with the restaurant, food, pricing, or service. I know what to expect and the quality of the food is always consistent.
author: Kurt W.

description:
If your fighting a cold or want something that will really heat you up this place will take care of you. I rarely see this place without a line. The place looks like a old bbq place and they just converted it to a tofu house. The soups are great and they ask you how hot you want them. They come in clay pots and the soups are boiling over. I think I might have burned my mouth every single time I've eaten here. The only thing that calms my mouth from the magma going down my throat is the fact that magma is DELICIOUS . Always constant and has never let me down. 

You get a bunch of food for what you pay for. Alot of side dishes and always seem fresh. Grilled meats are pretty good as well. A lot of flavor. 

Again, like alot of places that I write about on Geary the parking sucks. Which is the curse of the Richmond area.
author: mark h.

description:
This is my new favorite korean restaurant!!! The tofu soups are soooo good!!! If you like tofu, and you like soups.... this is the best place to go. You can ask for mild if you can't handle the spiciness like me. The kalbi is probably close to the best I've had as well... although the bee bim bop wasn't all that memorable.
Service was also great... waiters are always friendly and attentive.
author: Gloria C.

description: This place is really nice to kid's . And they do not charge for the soup that they serve for them. They offer great fast service for a nice comforting meal. Order the Kal Bi and Soon Du Buji(Spicy) This is the place for TOFU soup.
author: jacqueline c.

description: Ask me 4 years ago what I thought of My Tofu House - spectacular.  I came in after moving back into the neighborhood and, I hate to say it, but it really disappointed me.  The tofu was off.  The rice was dry.  The seafood wasn't very good.  Well, the tea service was pretty decent, but other than that, I left with half of the food untouched and embarrassed to have brought in a newbie after all the praise I gave my once beloved go-to Korean BBQ place.
author: Desiree C.

description:
I was an instant fan of the Dumpling Tofu Soup.  And as a creature of habit... that's what I tend to get!  There's just something so tasty about dumplings and tofu all boiled together.  And all those side dishes they give you!  I tend to hog the cucumber one...  And love their tea!  Plus they give you this melon bubble gum with the check... Too bad the gum only has enough flavor to last till you walk out the door.  But anyways, my friends and I have enjoyed this place.

My general comments are that this place is a little expensive, so it makes me afraid to try other things on their menu because I'm afraid of paying that much for disappointing food.  Also, service during the really busy hours can really lag...  One time we got our side dishes after we got our soup and rice! Totally not cool.
author: Jenn G.

description: I love this restaurant.  Great sundubu, lots of side dishes, and a good place to bring Korean-food virgins because they can choose how spicy they want their soup (though mild sundubu is so boring!)  Bulgogi is good too.  Almost every time I've been here it's been packed, but there is a tiny room in the back for overflow.  Minus one star for a long wait because they don't take reservations.
author: Allison Y.

description: Brown Rice, please. Also please reduce MSG. Thanks.
author: Tevantheesa L.

description:
This place never gets old!

Other reviewers have complained about the limited menu selection, but as the title "my tofu house" implies, the restaurant specializes in Tofu Soup, so don't expect a wide range of other Korean food.

In addition to the soup, the BBQ meat is also worth getting.  The portions may be a little skimpy, but the quality of it compensates for it.  You also get a wide variety of side-dishes and rice, which comes in stone pots.

Whether you are feeling under the weather, or just craving Tofu soup, this is the place to go.
author: Edward L.

description: I adore My Tofu House, the food, all of it, is fantastic, the service terrific, the prices are right, the portions are perfect. We go here at least once a month, often more than that. I am so happy that My Tofu House is so close to our house!
author: Arielle G.

description: Went here with a large group and the food was pretty affordable and tasty!  The place is clean, although a bit far from everything.  The short ribs were scrumptious and the bi bim bop was nice too.  Of course, we were all fighting for the good pickled sides and weren't too fond of the head-on fishes.  But hey, the rest of it was pretty awesome.  Bottomless barley tea is also a nice benefit.  Yum.
author: Coral F.

description: The seafood tofu soup is my favorite - just ask for the mild version, otherwise you'll explode from all the spices!  My dinner companion can not feel his lips....still numb from the hot sauce.  This place serves plenty of food and the wait-staff usually provides speedy service.  There are always long lines so getting in early pays off.  My only gripe are the prices!  Some of the stuff is really over-priced and the menu needs to be updated with better variety of dishes.
author: Daria i.

description: They have different levels of spiciness for their soon tofu, starting with completely unspicy (i don't understand the people who get it this way. it's the spiciness that makes soon tofu so good!). Then there's mild, medium, and spicy. What they don't show you on the menu is that you can take that spiciness even further, with 5 additional levels of spiciness after spicy. I started out at level 2 and it wasn't all that spicy. I did 4 and I was sweating. The last time I went, I asked for level 3 and I learned that the 5 additional levels of spiciness ARE NOT very consistent because the level 3 I got that night was much much hotter than the level 4 I had previously! It was a thick bubbling red paste that can only be described as lava-like, and it was *almost* painful to eat it. But the soon tofu here just tastes so good there was no way I wasn't going to finish it....I just kept the waiters busy with my requests for refills of water :)
author: Cristofer P.

description: Good food!!! You just have to get there early before the dinner time otherwise, feel free to wait  and wait....
author: Lanny K.

description: yesterday was a little chilly and gloomy... perfect weather for soondubu jigae!  luckily we got there before it got too crowded and quickly got a seat.  it can get crowded quick.  i went with the mushroom soondubu jigae, always lots of good shrooms.  the pak ban is a little paltry, but at least they had chogi fish.  definitely can't beat this place on a cold evening to warm up!
author: Jeremy S.

description: My favorite Korean spot in SF. The tofu soups are good, but the real standout dish here is the daeji bulgogi (spicy pork): it arrives on a sizzling platter and is tender and full of flavor. Yum.
author: Matt B.

description:
let's just make this clear once in for all ... 

*sigh*

when will i ever go to a korean place with a korean person? hopefully before i move back down to so cal ... 

one day ... 

someday...

one of these days, a korean person will *hopefully* pop my kimchi cherry ... =0

so the day i get back from NYC, he asks me whether i had plans on wed, and if i did, to cancel the plans if and only if possible. after i cancelled plans, he then tells me that we were going to watch another warriors game. of course, my eyes grew big as i was stoked since i had a blast at the last celtics/warriors game.

then, the day rolls around and he says, "sry, i was kidding. we're just going to watch it at home.." UNTIL 630PM...i was a bit upset because i was SO looking forward to the game...

gosh, i hate ppl who pull pranks like that.. :( it aint april fools...and later says, "ill show you what k food is all about..." so he takes me to my tofu house.

you seriously can NOT mess up on tofu soup, it's just tofu and soup. how hard could it be????  the food was pretty good, including the broiled sliced meat (bulgogi).

unlike LA, i have to say that it's nice to know that the prices are consistent with lunch and dinner. for $9.45, i was happy, but i'm used to paying $8. lol. quite a variety, but do get the seafood *EXTRA EXTRA SPICY* =D (and it STILL* unfortunately wasn't spicy enough for me...) he got the original for mild, and it was as sweet as it can be... 

be aware! the bulgogi was $8 for lunch (that's actually a great price, but since we came for dinner, we paid $16, and of course $16 is NOT worth it).

their stoneware bibimbap was so so... and of course for $13, was def not worth it. their sidedishes were fresh and the servers were really friendly too. 

if this is your first time in here, and you see a line, be sure to go to the front and sign in or else you'll be booted to the back.




PS. yes, we did end up going to the oracle.
author: Jennifer S.

description: soon dubu is great.  meat is tasty and good quality.  solid gold.
author: Ernest S.

description: Good food, but I'm giving it 4 stars instead of 5 because the last few times I went there, it took over an hour to get my food after I ordered.  And the food was given at different times.  One person would get their dish and then the other people in the group would have to wait another 20 minutes or so before their food came.   So it was difficult to enjoy the meal together.  By the time one person started eating, some of the others were done.  That's pretty bad service.  I know it was poor service because they are always short-staffed, especially on the weekends.  The owner should hire some more servers.
author: David L.

description: mmm the tofu soups are much tastier than buncha places in sf, los angeles, san diego...
author: Ethan L.

description: Not just one of my favorite Korean restaurants in the Bay Area, but one of my favorite restaurants, in general. Never been disappointed, and everyone I've brought has been happy.
author: Timothy L.

description: Tofu bi bim bap. We waited for a long time but I'm glad we did. The hot pot was excellent, the tofu was had a great grilled flavor and all the veggies were perfect. The side dishes (most were vegetarian) were fresh and crunchy and flavorful. The service was prompt. Will go again but only if it's early.
author: Sarah J.

description: Like most other reviewers here, I LOVE THIS PLACE.  The waiters are really nice and they run a pretty tight ship.  I've been here 5 times and have never had to wait more than 20 minutes.  Every single time I've been here, my eating partner and I each get our own soup and we share an order of kalbi.  The kalbi is nicely flavored and ALWAYS fall of the bone tender.  Yum.  It makes my mouth water just thinking about it.  The side dishes are good, too.  I think the prices are a little steep for dinner ($40 for the meal described above), but it's really, really, really good.
author: Trinh N.

description:
very tasty

my friend and i had #8 and #2, 8 was the dumpling soup - i had it medium hot and 2 was the seafood one i think, that was mild.
both were delicious. afterward my tongue went into shock, after the realization that it was being salted on by the very very good soups, esp on a cold dec day.

damage was $24 with tip, will go back!
author: Porkers T.

description: Is it just me or is this pace not as good as it used to be? I used to frequent this place but stopped going for a while. went back last week and it just seemed like the food was not as flavorful anymore. I guess the long line of peple waiting to get in disagrees but hey, just sayin'
author: Vincent L.

description: I really liked their attentive service.  I can't really grade them higher though because in all fairness, I only had the kimchi tofu soup since I was sick and didn't feel like eating a lot.  Maybe if I visit this place in the future and get to order a real entree, then I'll be able to give a better idea.  Not bad, but I can't say it was great simply by trying their soup that didn't exactly wow me, despite that being what this place is known for apparently.
author: Joel J.

description: I was able to enjoy a sampling of various dishes and they were all excellent. My favorite was the bbq pork.
author: jjj z.

description: If I'm ever in the area I will def. be coming back here. Hot boiling soup just hits the spot on those cold foggy SF days! I love all the side dishes too - especially the fried fish. MMmmm
author: su l.

description: i heard this place has lines out the door during the weekends.  im not a tofu person but once in a blue moon i will get craving for korean tofu soup.  place was pretty good, no complaints but it didnt wow me either.  service was quick and not too shabby for a korean place.  i had the dumpling tofu soup which was a nice change cause i usually get the seafood.  good place if you really love tofu soup.
author: Tiffany L.

description: If I could eat there more often I would, but the lines are too much for me to handle.  The food is what I remember Korean food to be in LA...so I would definitely recommend it.  Good amount of banchan and the spices in the tofu soup are just right.
author: Marsha L.

description: the soon doo bu is good, the bimbimbap is good, the service is good.  the only reason why i give it 4 stars is because the selection is not as big as other korean restaurants i've been too.  sure its a tofu house, but at least have some more selection.
author: Tony L.

description: their meat are the best for the meat lovers.... their tofu in a bowl is not so good.. we ordered spicy and its not even spicy....  great for sharing with friends..
author: Lily T.

description: this place rocks...i think much better than the so bay choices...
author: Rob C.

description: Great food, but a bit pricy for tofu soup/stew.   Services are good and I love the small plates that come with the food.   Sometimes, the wait is a bit long, too.   But for sure I will go back!
author: Maggie L.

description: The soondubu dishes here are reasonably priced; the one with ramen sounds like a great concept but instead of using fresh noodles they basically throw in a pack of instant ramen, so thumbs down. The pajeon is basically like deep dish pajeon and so worth paying a few bucks extra for (but I don't know if it's worth paying $20). The waitstaff keep the banchan coming; you don't even have to ask.
author: A. T.

description: Among the Korean restaurants in the City, My Tofu House's signature dish, its soon-doobu (tofu soup) stands in a class of its own. The decor is rather plain and unassuming, but there's a reason why patrons will likely encounter a 20-30 minute wait during peak dining hours on the weekends. Aside from its selection of tofu soups, the remaining menu at My Tofu House is unextraordinary but respectable. Nevertheless, the soon-doobu makes dining at My Tofu House worthwhile in and of itself.
author: John O.

description: Fish Egg Soup and Kol Bi are excellent five star dishes! Love it. No alcohol, don't love it.
author: Phillys R.

description: yummy! the kimchi sundubu ...hot, spicy...definitely hits the spot! yummy side dishes. quaint little spot.
author: Diana N.

description: best soft tofu I've ever eaten!  the bulgogi is a bit pricey, but its high quality =)  Go early on weekends because after 6pm the place is packed!
author: Marissa N.

description: i had tofu/chicken soup, #1. it was fine, soup broth was bland. i had high hopes and think other dishes might be better. will likely go back...
author: Noah K.

description: went here today after watching "diary of a foodie" on kqed.  we love this place.  we always get the dumpling soft tofu soup.  it's soooo good!  we always leave full.
author: Jennifer D.

description: I. LOVE. TOFU. SOUP.  I like it hot and spicy... so delicious...  mmm, and what I love about this place is I know its legit because one of my Korean friends who grew up in the area brought me here, so I have to trust that she's knows whats up, right?  Yeah... we'll just say yes and hope for the best.  Seriously though, I could have this ever week, but somehow I don't find the red teeth stains all that attractive.  Just a thought.  I agree that they could use at least another person when it gets busy, but its worth it... until I find my next tofu house spot.  Or buy one of those [supposedly cancer causing] clay pots for myself.  =)  Get here early!  I got here with a couple of friends around 6:30p on a Friday, and the place got packed pretty quickly after that.  So basically, you're SOL after 6:45p.
author: Margie N.

description: this is my favorite tofu house in the city. the tofu soup is very tasty. the rice comes out in the clay pot which i love bc i really like to pour tea in the remaining rice and eat that with everything. not all tofu places have rice in the clay pot. some places just bring out rice from a rice cooker. the side dishes are good and the fried fish is yummy. when you order to go though, they dont give you the fish unless you ask.  i usually order one to go for the next day.
author: chloe w.

description: cant' go wrong with tofu house ... been coming here for years ... clean place with excellent service everytime ... im addicted to the fish egg tofu soup ,... EXCELLENT for a cold night ...
author: Frankie L.

description: $14 dolsot bibimbab? even though it was good, it's seriously overpriced. i would say every dish is about $2-3 more than la prices. however, it was a really cute place and the waitstaff were really attentive.
author: eve l.

description: when it's cold and rainy in san francisco.. or just any kind of cold weather.. perfect.. soondubu
author: Timothy W.

description: finally!  growing up in southern cal, korean restaurants are plentiful, authentic and really good (almost as good as homemade, i think)!  but i've been hard-pressed to find anything in SF that comes close... i sort of like "korea house" in the fillmore, and "brothers bbq" in the richmond.  but now... "my tofu house" takes the top han-guk spot in my book.  friendly waiters, clean, and good ban-chan!  the soon-doo-boo is good - and last night we had a vegie bibimbab, stone pot style - very good.  i've also had the bulgogi (beef) here but wasn't as impressed; stick to brothers bbq for your korean beef needs.  "my tofu house" is a good choice for good korean food!
author: Ken L.

description: The real star of My Tofu House is quite literally the tofu! It is soft and I think it's made there. But the sort of softness is just SO sublime! It melts in your mouth. On to the rest of the food, truly delicious chapchae, with specks of beef and the sauce on it makes you want to eat it and eat it and eat it. The padyeon (sp?), scallion pancake, was decent, maybe a little underdone for my tastes because I like it crispy. I would seriously get a Korean soup here with tofu in it next time, because the tofu was seriously good. The bimbimbap is stellar also and one of the best ones I've ever had.  Portions are HUGE here (by the way)! But, a warning, most Korean food really breaks the budget in terms of price. It tends towards the pricey side for dishes, but the portions are a good size and you get little dishes of fermented and pickled goodness, like 2-3 different types of kimchi, picked bean sprouts, marinated tofu, etc. The beef dishes look and sound especially good but bring plenty of friends to share to split the cost!
author: Gina R.

description: One of my favorite korean places to go to. This place has the total package for me. My favorite type of tofu soup, my favorite type of appetizers (the little anchovies, kimchi, bean sprouts, and the cucumbers) YUM! They also have the broiled chicken that is also really good. I love it here. The service can be a bit slow whenever it's at night and its over crowded, but whatever the food is good here. The rice comes in a clay pot that has actually been cooking in it, you can tell becasue there is still rice that sticks onto the side of the clay pot which makes some of the rice crispy and crunchy which makes it extra tasty! The wait for tables here gets kinda crazy at times, they waiting list can go on forever! But I believe its worth the wait, and knowing me I HATE WAITING FOR THINGS. other than this palce =] ITS THAT GOOD. Go here! no regrets! It's a bit pricey btw, but like i said, its worth it!
author: Johnny T.

description: This is the place I go to when I want a nice hot bowl of tofu soup and meat.  The  soup has a lot of flavor to it, and the bulgogi is not dry at all.  This is just one of those places you can rely on getting some good korean food, w/o any of that korean bbq scent.  I left out a star because it didn't have the tofu side dish I like.
author: Pinkyton C.

description: i love this place. all i gotta say, service can be kinda slow sometimes, but other than that, its awesome.
author: Tony P.

description: I LOVE Tofu House.  They have the best tofu bowls.  I haven't yet found another place that makes it as good as theirs.  My fav is #4 with kimchee.  The bibimbap is ok.  Not too crazy about their other dishes.   If it weren't for the crazy lines, I would go there more often.
author: renee t.

description: this is a decent soon dubu place. its not amazing nor horrible. it satisfies my soon dubu cravings from time to time. but honestly (not to brag or anything), i make better soon dubu soups than theirs... :P
author: E S.

description:
I went here for lunch today with a couple of friends and we decided to try a variety of dishes here. So we ordered the original soft tofu soup with pork, combination pancake, the bbq beef and vegetables bibimbap and the bulgoki(which is thin slice of rib eye). Often when i come here with my friend we would eat all the kimchi, but this time we didn't because our main dishes came quite quickly. The bibimbap is delicious! it might be one of my favorite dishes here now! Before i use to just get the tofu soup(that's good too) the bulgoki was good too everything was good except the pancake, that was okay it lacked flavor. They told us they charged us dinner price for the bulgoki because it was a holiday, we were fine with that because we were splitting everything evenly. After coming here many times i noticed that we usually have to wait to be seated when its a friday or saturday night, but if you come before the rush you can get your table quickly! The service is quite friendly. Overall this one of my favorite restaurants and i defiantly recommend it if you're craving korean food! 

oh yes i forgot to say our bill $60
author: jenny c.

description: Solid Korean food, good kimchee, and untypically cheap for a Korean restaurant.
author: Joe S.

description: I've been to Korea and had real Korean food, but this place still has the best soondubu and the Bulkogi! My favorite Korean place in the Bay Area. I love their Spicy Seafood Soft Tofu (soondubu).
author: Yumi S.

description:
this place is 4 star if you go during off times, but if you go for dinner rush, that drops b/c:
- they're so rushed & understaffed they dont' have time to go through ceremony of adding water to crispy rice remains at bottom of stone pot.
-they can't be flagged down for more kim chi.
yes, the tofu jigae is great (i like seafood or mushroom, pretty spicy), but service suffers.
author: Kim Y.

description: This is the place when you need your spicy soup fix.  The Tofu soups are great and reasonably priced.  This place is also nice if you want some korean bar bbq, but don't want to cook it yourself.  It's cheap, comparatively , too.  Very stale environment, so I wouldn't recommend going for a special occasion.
author: Gary W.

description: I'm not a huge fan of Korean food but I do love good food.  I tried what people recommended but just don't get the hype.  The tofu soup and meat dishes were quite bland.  Customer service also wasn't so great.  We were sitting at our table for about five minutes before someone even brought us the menu...and the place wasn't even that busy at the time!  Would I come back?...Probably not.
author: Sally Trung N.

description: great korean food. the best ive had in norcal. to get the BEST korean food you have to go down to socal! anyways it gets pretty packed after 730 so come early if you can. everything is steaming hot  (temperature wise) so be prepared. a little pricey, 10 dollars for soup and about 15 bucks for meat. but worth it!
author: A B.

description: this is my 4th time going here.. love it each time.. I always get the assorted mushroom tofu soup.. tofu is so smooth..mushrooms yummy.. the kal-bi (beef short ribs) is soft and flavorful.. only thing is.. it's in the richmond district.. hard to find parking.. but, it doesn't stop me from coming back!
author: Linda Y.

description: We love tofu houses - we go when we are starting to feel a little under the weather and eat lots of kimchi and seafood tofu soup, and it really works - chases the cold away.  We come to My Tofu House with our 3 year old, and though there is a bit of a wait, we bring toys and once the food comes, it's great.  The restaurant is informal and has large booths, so it is perfect for bringing our kid and not disturbing the other diners.  The side dishes are very good, and there is a good assortment.  We always get the tofu soup - I taught English in Korea for a summer and that and bulgogi were my main staples because I can't handle a lot of spice.  I like the soup a lot - best in the city.  We used to go to Alameda to an even better tofu house, but it closed down, so this is our destination of choice now.  I agree the food has not been as consistently good as of late - I am hoping this is a temporary thing, but even when it is off, it is still pretty good.
author: M D.

description: i love this place. it has never dissappointed me. they have 100% score card and the food is yummy. im going there right now. =)
author: Dien N.

description: the food was not bad, but over priced for the quality. service was mediocre and slow. we asked for tea and the boss replied "what's your f***ing problem?".  there are other tofu houses out there with better customer service, quality of food, and cheaper price.
author: Brazil S.
